title: WATERMELON GRANITA
blurb: To this day I'm yet to find a more refreshing treat to enjoy on a blasting hot day.
method: Combine the sugar and 250 ml (1 cup) water in a saucepan over medium heat and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Remove the pan from the heat and set aside.
Puree the watermelon in a food processor, then pour in the sugar syrup and lemon juice and blend until smooth and well combined.

Pour the mixture into a couple of clean baking trays, then pop them in the freezer. Come back every hour or so and scrape with a fork to break up the ice crystals that have formed. Repeat this four to five times until you have a fluffy, icy consistency.
To serve, spoon the granita into bowls, garnish with mint and enjoy as an icy respite from a hot day in the garden.
